Posts.Content: starting 8th month of xtandi, PSA still holding at .1, now taking prednisone instead of Celebrex for joint pain and it seems to be helping! It has been 3 years now since initial stage IV diagnosis, it's been rough at times but 2 of our 4 daughters have gotten to have their dad attend their college graduation! praying that he will get to see the youngest graduate high school in 3 more years!
Posts.Title: stage IV diagnosis 33 months ago!

Posts.Title: stage IV diagnosis 33 months ago!

Posts.Content: my husband was 46 yrs old when he was diagnosed with stage IV prostate cancer spread to bones and lymph nodes with a PSA of 987! Yes, 987!!! he is seeing a prostate cancer specialist in Houston, not at MDA, but who is considered to be an expert in prostate cancer. We originally went to UAMS and were given 12-18 months! he started out with 9 months of chemo, adriamycin one week, taxotere the next, 6 weeks on 2 weeks off, PSA went down to .1, also treated with lupron, ketoconazole and hydrocortisone. All 12 biopsies were Gleason 8, 9 and 10's. Did 44 daily radiation treatments after chemo. pSA held for a few months then in October 2012 jumped back up to 346! he restarted chemo in October 2012 thru October 2013, PSA back down to 1.5, then started xtandi the middle of October 2013, been on it for 4 months now and PSA down to .1 but was really tired for the first 3 months of xtandi. He is finally starting to feel better! Not sure what to expect next just glad to still be in the fight. Also still on lupron, xgeva, hydrocortisone and Celebrex for joint pain. Is there anybody else who has been on xtandi and if so how long before it stops working?
Posts.Title: stage IV diagnosis 33 months ago!

Posts.Title: stage IV diagnosis 33 months ago!

Posts.Content: He is taking the Xtandi at night but has lots of aching joints and flu-like side effects. Can't hardly go somedays. We were just wondering how long on average before it stops working. He is also taking lots of pain medication. Originally Posted by Rich S I was diagnosed 16 months ago at age 56, Gleason 5+4, mets to bone and nodes PSA 180 at diagnosis, 191 30 days later at start of treatment. Started on Firmagon in Nov 2012 and PSA dropped to 4 stalled and then took off like a rocket reaching 30 in Sept of 2013. My doc added Casodex with no effect, Zytiga and prednisone also failed with no change. I started Xtandi with a #5 prednisone in mid Sept and my psa continued a slow climb peaking at 31.8 in December and now as of last week has dropped to 28. The only issues I have with Xtandi is that it has distorted my sense of smell and taste and my wife tells me I am a lot more forgetful. I would suggest taking the Xtandi as well as all of the other a** kicking drugs as he is crawling into bed at night so that he sleeps through the worse of the side effects.
